title: A Day of Smiles, Strength & Shared Dreams at Janeshwar Mishra Park
description:
A Day of Smiles, Strength & Shared Dreams at Janeshwar Mishra Park 

Today was one of those days that quietly reminds us why we do what we do.

The mentors of Perhit Siksha Foundation, Lucknow came together with our mentees (beneficiaries) and their families for a warm, joyful, and deeply meaningful get-together at the serene Janeshwar Mishra Park.

Around 40 beneficiaries, along with their parents, joined us—turning the gathering into a beautiful blend of young aspirations, parental hopes, and collective encouragement. What unfolded was not just an event, but a living example of mentorship in action.

The session began with introductions, where each child spoke about themselves--some confidently, some shyly, but all with sincerity. This was followed by morale-boosting interactions that gently reminded our children of their immense potential.

A special highlight was the inspiring address by our senior mentor, Smt. Seema Jain, whose words resonated deeply with the beneficiaries. Her motivating message on giving their best in studies, believing in themselves, and staying consistent struck a powerful chord with both children and parents alike.

To keep the atmosphere lively and engaging, the session featured the classic and much-loved game “Atlas”, enthusiastically facilitated by our mentor Sh. Abhishek Raj, where laughter, quick thinking, and teamwork filled the air.

We also had an interactive discussion on Republic Day, helping children connect with the values of our Constitution, patriotism, and their role as responsible citizens of tomorrow—just a day before the nation celebrates this proud occasion.

The session concluded with light refreshments, informal conversations, and smiles all around—simple moments that build trust, bonding, and a sense of belonging. Parents shared their thoughts, children laughed freely, and mentors felt quietly fulfilled.

From candid smiles to thoughtful expressions, we captured these precious moments through our cameras—memories that will stay with us long after the day ends.

A heartfelt thanks to our dedicated mentors who made this gathering so enriching and memorable:

Smt. Seema Jain

Sh. Prashant Mishra

Sh. Bablu Gupta

Sh. Abhishek Raj

Smt. Akanksha Srivastava

Sh. Nirankar Jaiswal

At Perhit Siksha Foundation, we believe education is not just about books—it’s about confidence, care, continuity, and community. Today reaffirmed our belief that when children are supported with empathy and guidance, they begin to dream bigger and walk stronger.

title: Sunil Shetty ji lends his voice to the cause of education — inspiring India to nurture a better t...
description:
Sunil Shetty ji lends his voice to the cause of education — inspiring India to nurture a better tomorrow.

From powerful performances on screen to a life guided by discipline, values, and social responsibility, Sunil Shetty ji has always stood for purpose beyond fame. Today, he extends his heartfelt support to a cause that shapes the very future of our nation — education for every child.

In his inspiring video message, Sunil Shetty ji speaks not just as a celebrated actor, but as a responsible citizen and a compassionate human being, emphasizing that education is the strongest foundation for empowerment, dignity, and lasting change.

His voice adds immense strength and credibility to the mission of Perhit Siksha Foundation — a collective commitment to ensure quality education for underprivileged children and to create opportunities where hope once seemed distant.

We express our sincere gratitude to Sunil Shetty ji for standing with Perhit Siksha Foundation and for motivating society to come together in this shared national responsibility.

Let us walk this path together — nurturing young minds, shaping futures, and building a brighter, educated tomorrow.

title: With profound sorrow and a heavy heart, the Perhit Siksha Foundation shares the sad news of the p...
description:
With profound sorrow and a heavy heart, the Perhit Siksha Foundation shares the sad news of the passing away of Shri Nilam Kant Arora ji, the revered father of our founding member Shri P. M. Arora ji, who passed away yesterday after courageously battling age-related complications for the past 20 days at Max Hospital Lucknow.

Shri P. M. Arora ji has been the very pillar of the Perhit Siksha Foundation since its inception- a mentor, an administrator, and a guiding light who has nurtured and shaped this mission selflessly from its earliest days, even before the Foundation formally came into existence. 

His commitment to service extends far beyond us; during the difficult days of the COVID-19 pandemic, he stood at the forefront as an active member of the Lucknow Covid Response Team, rendering tireless service through relief initiatives and the Covid Kitchen for patients’ attendants.

As he endures this irreparable personal loss, the entire Perhit Siksha Foundation family stands firmly with him --united in prayer, solidarity, and shared grief.

We earnestly pray to the Almighty to grant strength, courage, and inner peace to Shri P. M. Arora ji and his family during this time of profound sorrow.

title: A New Beginning in Lucknow
description:
A New Beginning in Lucknow

We are happy to share that Perhit Shiksha Foundation has formally opened its office in Lucknow, strengthening our commitment to accessible and quality education for underprivileged children.

Office Address:
H. No. 659, Eldeco Udyan-I, Sector-3, Bangla Bazar, Dilkusha, Lucknow – 226002

Standing proudly in front of the office in the photograph is Smt. Seema Jain, one of the Directors of Perhit Shiksha Foundation. She is a retired Assistant Commissioner from CGST Lucknow, whose experience, integrity, and dedication to public service continue to guide our mission.

This office marks an important milestone as we expand our outreach, deepen community engagement, and work more closely with students, mentors, and supporters.

title: Recently, Perhit Shiksha Foundation organized a heart-touching interaction session at GPL Memoria...
description:
Recently, Perhit Shiksha Foundation organized a heart-touching interaction session at GPL Memorial School, Haridwar, bringing together twenty-five bright scholarship recipients from Classes 2 to 9. What unfolded was a beautiful exchange of smiles, stories, laughter, and dreams. The room resonated with curiosity, confidence, and quiet determination --small voices carrying big aspirations.

As the year draws to a close, the gathering was wrapped in warm Merry Christmas and New Year wishes, filling young hearts with joy, reassurance, and renewed belief in a brighter tomorrow.

When education meets care, futures take shape.

As we step into a new year, we reaffirm our commitment to nurturing young minds, empowering dreams, and spreading hope — one child at a time.

May the season of giving continue to inspire compassion, purpose, and collective action throughout the year.

title: A Proud Milestone for Perhit Siksha Foundation!
description:
A Proud Milestone for Perhit Siksha Foundation! 

We are delighted to share a momentous achievement in our journey of giving every child the gift of education and dignity.

Perhit Siksha Foundation — the evolution of the CLSI/CVSI Child Education Programme — has now been officially registered as a Section 8 Company under the Companies Act, 2013.

This recognition marks a new chapter of credibility, transparency, and expanded impact for our mission.

Certificate of Incorporation issued by the Ministry of Corporate Affairs confirms our registration as a non-profit company dedicated to educational upliftment. 

We have been granted the Section 8 Licence, recognizing that our objectives are purely charitable and focused on promoting education, empowering children, and creating long-term social value.

What This Means-----

• A stronger institutional framework for supporting underprivileged children.
 
• Ability to expand our reach, partnerships, and social impact

• A renewed commitment to ensuring that every contribution transforms a child’s life

This milestone belongs to every officer, mentor, volunteer, and supporter who has believed in the cause since the early days of CLSI/CVSI. Your compassion has built a foundation that will now grow even stronger as Perhit Siksha Foundation.

Together, let us continue lighting the lamp of education and changing lives — one child at a time.

title: Proud Moment for CLSI Social Initiatives-Child Education Programme!
description:
Proud Moment for CLSI Social Initiatives-Child Education Programme!

Our beneficiary Aditya secures 8th position in Uttarakhand!

Today, we are delighted to share an inspiring achievement that reflects the true spirit of our Child Education Programme. 

Aditya, a bright and determined student supported under Perhit Siksha Foundation - Child Education Programme, has secured the 8th position in the Uttarakhand High School Examination 2025, conducted by the Vidyalayi Shiksha Parishad, Ramnagar (Nainital).

He has been honoured with the Pt. Deendayal Upadhyaya Shaikshik Utkrishta Puraskar, a prestigious recognition for academic excellence.

Aditya’s hard work, resilience, and commitment are truly admirable.
We are proud that our collective efforts in supporting underprivileged children are helping them rise and transform their future.

A big thank you to all officers, mentors, and supporters of Perhit Siksha Foundation who continue to believe in the power of education and stand behind these young minds.

Together, we are not just funding education--
we are shaping lives, building confidence, and creating tomorrow’s leaders.

Congratulations, Aditya!

May you continue to shine and inspire many more children to dream beyond limitations.

title: A Heart-warming Learning Day with Our Perhit Siksha Foundation Children----
description:
A Heart-warming Learning Day with Our Perhit Siksha Foundation Children---- 

On 16th November, our respected mentor Smt. Seema Jain Ma’am spent a meaningful day with Perhit Siksha Foundation children at Begum Hazrat Mahal Park and Smriti Upvan, filling the day with smiles, confidence and hope.

At Begum Hazrat Mahal Park, young children from primary classes opened up freely about their learning difficulties—from multiplication and spellings to understanding tough words. Their honesty and eagerness to improve were truly inspiring. Ma’am guided parents to help children at home through simple mental maths, regular dictations, a peaceful study environment and daily communication.

Later at Smriti Upvan, students from Classes 7 to 11 impressed Ma’am with their dedication, discipline and dreams. She shared that she could clearly see hope and aspiration in every child’s eyes—a desire to become self-reliant through education.

We express our heartfelt gratitude to Seema Ma’am for her time, guidance and her compassionate connection with the children.

Here are a few glimpses from this enriching day.
